intro: Manfreda santana-michelii, commonly known as the Santana-Michelii manfreda, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Peridiscaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that store water, enabling it to survive in arid environments. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is often sought after by collectors and botanists.
